iati-activity.description: Households in 2 priority districts adopt recommended practices that support maternal nutrition, infant and young child feeding andcare.

indicator.description: Behaviour change communication materials standardised and being used for complementary feeding at household level. (2010: 0 2016: 15 districts)

Scale Up Nutrition (SUN) / 1000 Special Days movement operationalised (2010: 0 districts 2016: 15 districts). Please note: out of 15 13 districts will receive Technical Support and two districts will be fully supported by UNICEF.

actual.value: On-going. Three districts rolled out the Scaling Up Nutrition 1 000 Special Days campaign using the Nutrition Education Communication Strategy. Technical support provided to three districts (1 WFP and 2 Irish Aid).

iati-activity.title: CHILD PROTECTION SERVICES
iati-activity.description: Ten of the most disadvantaged communities in each of 250 Traditional Authorities adopt protective child protection practices andhave access to an expanded range of protection services that include early identification, case management, referral and HIV careand support, by 2016.

indicator.description: Number of communities having access to to an expanded range of protection services that include early identification case management referral and HIV care and support (Baseline: 0 Target: 2500).

actual.value: 37 500 children in 63 Traditional Authorities and 475 communities (7 communities in each of the 63 TAs) access an expanded range of protection services that include early identification case management referral and HIV care and support through the police community level support child helpline and one stop centres.

indicator.description: Number of communities adopting protective child protection practices (Baseline: 0 Target: 2500)

iati-activity.title: HIV AIDS PROCUREMENT SUPPLY CHAIN MGT
iati-activity.description: Supply chain management capacity for HIV/AIDS ensures an effective delivery of maternal, new-born and child health commodities by2016

indicator.description: % of health facilities with drugs in stock and no stockouts of more than 1 week (disaggregated by type of drug: Ols STIs ARVs HTC Testing Kits) (2010: 63% : 2016 : 90%)

actual.value:
We have adequate commodities at central level to ensure zero stock outs but there are issues with distribution to district and facility levels that should be overcome to ensure zero stock out at facility levels.
One of the major bottlenecks is that 92% of the budget comes from the donors. This brings sustainability under question.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: HIV PREVENTION FOR OUT OF SCH ADOL & YTH
iati-activity.description: ;HIV PREVENTION FOR OUT OF SCH ADOL & YTH

80% of out-of-school adolescents and young women in 10 high prevalence districts have capacity, skills and access to HIV preventionservices (including education, condom distribution, and HIV testing and counseling [HTC]) implemented at national level by 2016

indicator.description: Number of health facilities providing HTC services
Number of people counselled and tested for HIV and receiving results in the last 12 months

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: NUTRITIONAL POLICY & OPERATIONAL REFORMS
iati-activity.description: The Nutrition Act developed, strategic plan/policy reviewed and incorporated in relevant SWAPs and District Development Plans.

indicator.description: Number of DIPs with nutrition interventions incoporated and budgeted (2010:0 2016:20)

actual.value: At least three districts have incorporated nutrition interventions in the District Implementation Plans and allocated funding. Other districts being followed-up for allocation of funding for nutrition activities. The national level (Ministry of Health) budgeted and allocated funds for nutrition intervention like procurement of therapeutic milks for CMAM program and integration of vitamin A and deworming in the Supplemental Immunization Campaign previously supported by UNICEF .

indicator.description: Nutrition Act in place

actual.value: Nutrition Act drafted and presented to stakeholders for their inputs. The finalization awaiting study tour planned early 2014 to South Africa and Belgium.

indicator.description: NNPSP revised and timeframe extended to 2013-2017

actual.value: National Nutritional Policy being revised. Nutrition Strategic Plan being revised and separated from the policy. Stakeholders meeting held where the policy and the strategy were presented and inputs provided informing the revisions.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: POLICY, BUDGET AND PLANS
iati-activity.description: Policy, Budget and Plans at national and district level strengthened and evidence-based case developed for investment in childrento influence social and economic policies, legislative measures, budgetary allocations and strategic planning processes.

indicator.description: % of rural and urban population able to claim human rights (disaggregaed by Gender) (2010: 16% females 19% males 20% urban 17% rural 2016: 50% Males: 50% Females 50% Urban 50 % rural)
District with Development Plan with child sensitive M&E framework (Baseline: 0 Target 10)
Publication of social budget analysis documents (Baseline: 0 Target: 5)
Public Expenditure Tracking Survey on one social sector completed and disseminated (Baseline: 0 Target: 1)
Performance Audit on one social sector completed and disseminated (0 1)
Studies on emerging issues for children conducted and diseminated.
A gender responsive National Human Rights Action Plan for the Promotion and Protection of Human Rights Developed and implemented (2011: 0 2016: 1)
Number of institutions aligning to a coordinated mechanism for human rights 2010: 0 2011: 9)

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: REGULATION AND COORDINATION

indicator.description: Number of districts with functioning technical coordination mechnims for GBV (2011:0 2016:28)
Number of district child protection committees that have in place plan for child protection in emergencies (2010:6 2016:28)

iati-activity.title: REPORTING ON CRC AND TREATIES
iati-activity.description: Quality reporting on CRC, African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child, and other relevant international treaties andconventions completed and submitted on time.

indicator.description: Centralized database with key child indicators at the national level has been established and is functional.
Submission of CRC report by the GoM on time with thorough analysis on child rights status.

actual.value: Discussion phase of the TOR for the consultant

indicator.description: Alternative CRC report by Civil society prepared in participatory process and submitted on time.

actual.value: Initial discussions conducted with the lead NGO coordinator

iati-activity.description: At least 1,600 in-school Anti-AIDS Clubs in 1,600 schools in 10 high prevalence districts are operational and delivering HIVprevention information by 2016.

iati-activity.title: HYGIENE PROMOTION
iati-activity.description: Effective interventions for the promotion of hygiene practices fully implemented in 15 districts by 2016

indicator.description: Number of people reached with messages on Hand Washing with Soap (HWWS) at critical times (baseline 0 target 1m)
Number of children in targetted CBCC's reached with hand washing with soap interventions (baseline:2 250 target: 50 000 )

iati-activity.title: MICRONUTRIENT FORTIFICATION & SUPPLIMENT
iati-activity.description: Quality assurance and surveillance systems improved for fortification and capacities developed at national and district levels formicronutrients supplementation

indicator.description: Percentage of under-five children and general population consuming adequately fortified sugar (2010: 0% 2016: 90%)

actual.value: On-going. Illovo Sugar Company has taken up the procurement of vitamin A fortificant for the program as part of their corporate responsibility.

indicator.description: Coverage of Vitamin A supplementation in 6 - 59 months children (2010: 71% 2016: 85%)

actual.value: On-going. Two rounds of Child Health Days campaign conducted. At least 95 per cent of children aged 12 to 59 months were also dewormed during the campaign. Second round integrated with Supplemental Immunization Activities.

indicator.description: Proportion of households consuming adequately iodised salt (2009: 87% 2016: >90%)

actual.value: On-going. National Salt Iodisation Program review meeting with stakeholders held. Functional national monitoring system in place with data reported on quarterly basis.

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

iati-activity.title: PMTCT AND PAEDIATRIC AIDS
iati-activity.description: Health facilities in 18 districts provide quality comprehensive Prevention of Mother-to-Child Transmission of HIV services andscale up paediatric HIV and AIDS care services by 2016

indicator.description: Number of health facilities providing EID to exposed infants (2010: 192 2016:300)
% of pregnant women who were tested for HIV and who know their results (2010:67% 2016:100%)
% of health facilities with ANC services with at least the minimum package of PMTCT services (2010: 78% 2016: 100%)

conditions.condition: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
